segments.text: I see the woman at the sink, completely focused on drying that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even notice the water overflowing all over the place.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, reaching for cookies, and it’s making me nervous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her turn, completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the whole scene is a bit sad, really.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so absorbed in her task that she’s missing everything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to cause so much damage if it keeps going like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm the garden looks outside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like the world inside is falling apart, but outside, everything is fine.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the woman turns around soon before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR
